channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Parts of New York and New England Brace for Ice Storm
item.description: Several states were under weather warnings or advisories early Monday. The same winter storm battered the Midwest over the weekend.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, sex symbol then animal activist, dies at 91
item.description: Her death was announced Sunday in a statement by her foundation, saying Bardot had chosen to abandon “her prestigious movie career to dedicate her lif...

item.title: Inside Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Break With Trump and MAGA
item.description: How the Georgia congresswoman went from the president’s loudest cheerleader to his loudest Republican critic.

item.title: Silver pulls back after topping $80 in historic year-end rally
item.description: Silver rose for a sixth session, building on a 10% gain on Friday that was its biggest one-day jump since 2008.

item.title: No one’s happier about calls for a ‘backseat Fed’ than Fed insiders who were targeted by the White House this year
item.description: "How much can truly change under a single administration?" I asked one source. "Three years is a long time yet," came the response.

item.title: Robinhood’s CFO transition played out over 7 years and included a powerful mentorship story
item.description: The CFO handoff from Jason Warnick to Shiv Verma shows how Robinhood has evolved from meme-stock disruptor to a serious S&P 500 corporation.

item.title: For Zelensky, Just Keeping Trump Talking About Ukraine Peace Deal Counts as a Win
item.description: Though discussions produced little tangible progress, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine at least avoided the type of setbacks that have blighted...

item.title: Five Takeaways From the New York Times Profile of Marjorie Taylor Greene
item.description: The congresswoman discussed her break with President Trump and her journey from MAGA zealot to political isolation.

item.title: Experts Question Denmark’s Vaccine Program as a Model for the U.S.
item.description: The United States is expected to adopt the vaccine schedule used by Denmark, a much smaller country with universal health care.

item.title: Claire Brosseau Wants to Die. Will Canada Let Her?
item.description: Ms. Brosseau says mental illness has made her life unbearable. She wants a medically assisted death. Even her psychiatrists are split over whether she...

item.title: The World Wants More Ube. Philippine Farmers Are Struggling to Keep Up.
item.description: Soaring demand and extreme weather worsened by climate change have wiped out harvests of the popular purple yam.

item.title: Five Takeaways From the New York Times Profile of Marjorie Taylor Greene
item.description: The congresswoman discussed her break with President Trump and her journey from MAGA zealot to political isolation.

item.title: Experts Question Denmark’s Vaccine Program as a Model for the U.S.
item.description: The United States is expected to adopt the vaccine schedule used by Denmark, a much smaller country with universal health care.

item.title: For Zelensky, Just Keeping Trump Talking About Ukraine Peace Deal Counts as a Win
item.description: Though discussions produced little tangible progress, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine at least avoided the type of setbacks that have blighted...

item.title: Interoceanic Train derails in southern Mexico, injuring at least 15 and halting traffic on line
item.description: The Interoceanic Train linking the states of Oaxaca and Veracruz derailed as it passed a curve near the town of Nizanda.
